repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Social Sector Management
            Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Social Sector Management
            Technical Assistance Project in Argentina are as follows:
            overall outcome of the project was rated highly
            satisfactory, and the performance of the Bank was
            satisfactory and the Borrower was rated deficient. Lessons
            learned from the project are: simplifying objectives,
            activities and institutional arrangements; defining a
            critical path and closely monitoring its execution;
            ascertaining that conditions are favorable for providing
            greater continuity in leadership and administration; and
            ensuring that the required expertise will be available.
            Lessons of experience should not detract from the merit of
            Govemment's and the Bank's decision-makers when
            the circumstances prevailing at the time of preparation and
            appraisal are taken into account. Those circumstances
            justified to a large extent the more ambitious original
            course of action for this project, and provided the
            framework for major reform under an Administration more
            favorably disposed to achieving its goals.

repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Social Sector Management
            Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Social Sector Management Technical
            Assistance Loan Project will assist the preparation and
            execution of reforms to improve the institutional and
            physical capacity to deliver social services to those who
            need them. Specifically the project will provide technical
            assistance to : (1) prepare and implement programs for
            improvements in resource allocation and utilization, cost
            recovery and targeting; (2) introduce administrative reforms
            and streamline processes in order to improve programming and
            budgeting of sectoral expenditures; (3) train federal and
            provincial sector managers; (4) build or strengthen
            information systems to support policy making and post
            evaluation capacity; and (5) put in place a better targeting
            system for the needy. Since the project is multisectoral, a
            coordinating unit will ensure that overall goals are
            reflected in the activities of each component. The loan will
            provide funds for consultant fees, training, vehicles,
            furniture and equipment, and civil works.
